title: Kyle Mooney Releases Debut Album The Real Me: Stream
description: The comedian adopted the moniker Kyle M for his "singular artistic vision unbound by genre." Kyle Mooney Releases Debut Album The Real Me: Stream Eddie Fu
author: Eddie Fu
excerpt: Comedian Kyle Mooney has released his debut album, The Real Me, via Stones Throw Records under the moniker Kyle M.
text: For comedian Kyle Mooney’s next bit, he’s adopted the moniker Kyle M and released his debut album, The Real Me. Stream it below. Entirely recorded, written, and produced by Mooney, The Real Me features 11 songs and clocks in at under 20 minutes. In a press release, the album is described as “a singular artistic vision unbound by genre,” spanning across rock, country, dance, and R&B. In the tongue-in-cheek mini-documentary accompanying the album, Mooney visits his purported childhood home and reminisces about his longtime love for music — all while insisting “there is nothing comedic about the Kyle M project.” Naturally, The Real Me offers plenty of laughs with amateurish tracks like “Kid of the Range,” where Mooney sings, “I’m just a lonely cowboy/ Who’ll never be a cow… man.” Similarly, his attempt at R&B, “ILY,” features lyrics like, “I trying to say I love you/ But I’m afraid to do it/ I wanna say I love you/ Oh heck, just screw it.” Vinyl pre-orders are ongoing. Mooney’s most recent projects include the 2021 Netflix live-action/animation hybrid Saturday Morning All Star Hits! and the A24 disaster horror comedy Y2K. The Real Me Artwork: The Real Me Tracklist: 01. Intro 02. Kid on the Range 03. Digital Society 04. Blue Car 05. Gwendolyn Bartley 06. California Summer 07. Disease 08. I Gotta Dance Tonight 09. House That’s Haunted 10. ILY 11. The Real Me
html:
For comedian Kyle Mooney’s next bit, he’s adopted the moniker Kyle M and released his debut album, The Real Me. Stream it below.

Entirely recorded, written, and produced by Mooney, The Real Me features 11 songs and clocks in at under 20 minutes. In a press release, the album is described as “a singular artistic vision unbound by genre,” spanning across rock, country, dance, and R&B.

In the tongue-in-cheek mini-documentary accompanying the album, Mooney visits his purported childhood home and reminisces about his longtime love for music — all while insisting “there is nothing comedic about the Kyle M project.”

Naturally, The Real Me offers plenty of laughs with amateurish tracks like “Kid of the Range,” where Mooney sings, “I’m just a lonely cowboy/ Who’ll never be a cow… man.” Similarly, his attempt at R&B, “ILY,” features lyrics like, “I trying to say I love you/ But I’m afraid to do it/ I wanna say I love you/ Oh heck, just screw it.”

Vinyl pre-orders are ongoing.

Mooney’s most recent projects include the 2021 Netflix live-action/animation hybrid Saturday Morning All Star Hits! and the A24 disaster horror comedy Y2K.

The Real Me Artwork:

The Real Me Tracklist:
01. Intro
02. Kid on the Range
03. Digital Society
04. Blue Car
05. Gwendolyn Bartley
06. California Summer
07. Disease
08. I Gotta Dance Tonight
09. House That’s Haunted
10. ILY
11. The Real Me
